metadata.title: CVE-2021-2007 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: CAPI). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior, 5.7.29 andprior and 8.0.19 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allowsunauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Client accessibledata. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.7 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2007` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.30-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
